title: ** New photos of Ty Cobb T206 from yesterday **
author: one-shot-robot

posts.post_title: ** New photos of Ty Cobb T206 from yesterday **
posts.post_content:
I received this card after my father passed away, Its been in our family for 30 plus years. I'm now wondering if it's authentic and what it could be worth.
 
Here is the link -   [url]https://imgur.com/a/DrAaY[/url]
I feel it is real and will probably grade a 2 (maybe a 3) based on the crease in the lower right corner
I am not an expert on this, but photos look MUCH better than the others!  Good luck.
I have a PSA 4 Red Cobb and that seems legit to me. I'm thinking it would grade as a nicely-presenting PSA 3.

Yep, it's real.  Old bb cards now typically get graded by a service that authenticates it. The card looks great but due to their parameters that they and our hobby uses, it probably would grade a 2 or 3 out of 10. Value is roughly $2k-2,500.  Hope this helps.

You see what happens when you post better pics, you get answers. Yesterday was a joke, some people were saying it was real, others saying 100% fake, the truth being, no one was able to tell. From what I see today, nice card, the lower right crease hurts the value. It should be one a nice 2  - 2 1/2 grade card. If you check eBay, you'll see 2 grades with asking prices from $1,300 to $2,500. It's worth what someone will pay in that range.

By the way...sorry for your loss.


Sent from my iPhone using Tapatalk
